intro: Origanum valentinum, commonly known as sweet marjoram, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its fragrant, small, white to pinkish flowers and its finely divided, aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its essential oils, rich in compounds like carvacrol and thymol, contribute to its medicinal and culinary uses. It is often used in herbal remedies for its calming and digestive properties.
